Title: mini_httpd: Arbitrary code execution
Synopsis:
A vulnerability in mini_httpd could allow remote attackers to
    execute arbitrary code.

Background.Text: mini_httpd is a small webserver with optional SSL and IPv6 support.

Description.Text: mini_httpd does not properly check for shell escapes when parsing HTTP requests.

Impact.Text: A remote attacker could send specially crafted HTTP requests, possibly resulting in execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the process, or allowing for overwriting of files.

Workaround.Text: There is no known workaround at this time.

P.Text:
Gentoo discontinued support for mini_httpd. We recommend that users
      unmerge mini_httpd:
